channel.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
channel.description:
Erlyndon Joseph "Joey" Lo, 27, of Plano, filed documents there Friday saying his religious beliefs entitled him to use deadly force to prevent an abortion.
http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20100406/ap_on_re_us/us_abortion_threat In Jesus' name. Suppose you save an embryo which then grows up to be THE WORLDS WORST ABORTION DOCTOR, would you still fight for its life then? What if it grew up to be gay or a democrate voter, would you stand up for it then?

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

This argument will never come to an end, and I don’t think any of us will change the others belief the slightest, so why do we have these arguments? To give us something to waste time doing?

The argument has come to an end in many parts of the world including much of Europe. In Italy for example, where 90% describe themselves as Catholic, abortion was made legal in the first 90 days of gestation in 1978 and overwhelmingly upheld in a referendum in 1981.
Abortion is not an election issue in most of Europe like it is in America.

There was debate in most of Europe in the 1960 and 1970s but now it seems a consensus has been reached.

Read full topic

Can I have some of that $999 trillion now?

item.source: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:24, topic:335889”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=432271.msg3175702#msg3175702 date=1270833325]

@yakman, this is far less religious and far more simply crazy person. You can’t blame this one on religion.

I’m not sure you can claim he isn’t as religious. After all he presumably would say you weren’t properly religious either because you don’t want to stand up for ‘babies’.
I don’t see how he isn’t a Christian like you when he worships the same Jesus, believes in the same God and derives his values from the same Bible.

He certainly thinks he is religious. I’m saying that he isn’t doing what any Christian religion in the world would advocate, unless maybe he tries to start his own. Again, I’m against abortion because I think it is murder, but murdering people because they possibly may commit murder is not the solution, trying to convince them otherwise would be better.

But again, this isn’t a religious thing, it’s a crazy person thing. If another atheist is a serial killer, and he is arrested and locked up, and then we find out about another, would it be fair for me to post a thread entitled “Lock up one atheist maniac and another takes his place!”, implying that you, as an atheist, are crazy as well? I don’t think that would be fair. Same case here.
[/quote]

In your example, there is an atheist who happens to be a serial killer, his atheism didn’t motivate his serial killing because its unlikely that an unbelief would tell you to do anything. But in the doctor-killer of this thread, his religion directly motivated his desire to kill doctors.

I appreciate that your religion doesn’t teach this and I’m sure it pains you when you see someone doing this in your religion’s name.

After eight murders, 17 attempted murders, 406 death threats, 179 assaults, and four kidnappings,[1][2] your pain must be very great seeing as your religion has been used to justify so many terrible acts.
Why don’t you do something about it? Your religion is being hijacked and we all hear nothing about it, just this silence and quiet denouncement.

Anyone can turn on their television and see Bill O’Reilly, Glenn Beck, Jerry Falwell, Pat Robertson and many other televangelists like the ones that converted the subject of this thread. You can watch them delivering touching rhetoric on abortion which clearly resonates with so many.

The pope as the leader of the Catholic church should be very concerned about his religion being hijacked to justify killing doctors. Does he say anything against it?
No, he talks about how abortion is a crime against society[3], likens it to Holocaust[4] and says it is corrupting society[5]. You’d think that in these statements he’s at least mention that killing abortion doctors is wrong.

If religious leaders didn’t want abortion doctors to be killed yet saw tens or hundreds of their followers attempting to do so, wouldn’t they say something about it? Wouldn’t they mention that their religion was being misused?
We hear nothing of that, we only hear about how terrible abortion is and that something must be done about it.

Do you understand why many in the pro-choice camp feel that you are liars?
Many feel you are all pretending to be upset, issuing statements about how much they deplore violence, but it’s just bullshit. Many people feel that this is exactly what you wanted to happen.

references:
(1) http://www.religioustolerance.org/abo_viol.htm
(2) http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/jan/24/warren-hern-america-late-abortion
(3) http://www.catholicnews.com/data/stories/cns/0506904.htm
(4) http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/4288103.stm
(5) http://www.euthanasia.com/pope2000.html[/quote]

no wikipedia reference? you’re slipping yakman

Read full topic
item.source: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“repacsenur, post:25, topic:335889”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=432271.msg3173364#msg3173364 date=1270603877]
I lol’d. What a retard. You know, it’s one thing to strongly believe in something, but it’s something else completely to force that view onto another.
I like how he didn’t consider that the religious views of the patients and doctors might allow abortion.

Arrogant piece of shit.

EDIT: Typo.
[/quote]

You sure? what if your beliefs tell you a black person should be a white mans slave or killing is part of nature and you have every right to kill anyone you like what about that.

There isn’t enough rules.

Like I am against abortion but not in the sense you may think I am against women actually having childern if they consider abortion then they should add some kind of a law if you abort your baby then your tubes must be tide forever so you will never be able to have another child sounds very fair in a sense of punishment it works both ways no more childern for you be happy because you aborted!.

I’ve seen this retarded girl who used to have sex in the males bathroom in school shes white but she had sex with a nigger everyday she got pregnant kept it private from her parents etc… then one day at school her baby was already ready she attempts to fix her problem so no one will ever know she was pregnant so she tries to pull her baby out in the bathroom which she does… and then attempts to flush it police came and defended this dumb girl and didn’t even care about the murder she did she should have her vagina stiched up in my opinion so she can only take it up the ass and feel pain everytime for what she died… some sins you do the retribution is really deserved and worth it.

If i was superman I’d force the government etc to do these laws or I’d take matters into my own hands and of course no one would be able to stop me…

Then again they got people who masterbate and kill sperm does that mean they should go to the sperm bank everytime they need to wack off? I don’t think so, even though its not the same thing because it’s only part of the baby but its still living things you are killing hack everyday you kill millions of skin cells by washing your face.[/quote]i hope for the fucking sake of humanity that this was a troll, else you should REALLY consider shutting the fuck up

Read full topic

Then again they got people who masterbate and kill sperm does that mean they should go to the sperm bank everytime they need to wack off? item.source: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:335889”][quote author=yakman link=topic=432271.msg3174809#msg3174809 date=1270748620]

@yakman, this is far less religious and far more simply crazy person. You can’t blame this one on religion.

I’m not sure you can claim he isn’t as religious. After all he presumably would say you weren’t properly religious either because you don’t want to stand up for ‘babies’.
I don’t see how he isn’t a Christian like you when he worships the same Jesus, believes in the same God and derives his values from the same Bible.
[/quote]

He certainly thinks he is religious. I’m saying that he isn’t doing what any Christian religion in the world would advocate, unless maybe he tries to start his own. Again, I’m against abortion because I think it is murder, but murdering people because they possibly may commit murder is not the solution, trying to convince them otherwise would be better.

But again, this isn’t a religious thing, it’s a crazy person thing. If another atheist is a serial killer, and he is arrested and locked up, and then we find out about another, would it be fair for me to post a thread entitled “Lock up one atheist maniac and another takes his place!”, implying that you, as an atheist, are crazy as well? I don’t think that would be fair. Same case here.[/quote]

In your example, there is an atheist who happens to be a serial killer, his atheism didn’t motivate his serial killing because its unlikely that an unbelief would tell you to do anything. But in the doctor-killer of this thread, his religion directly motivated his desire to kill doctors.

I appreciate that your religion doesn’t teach this and I’m sure it pains you when you see someone doing this in your religion’s name.

After eight murders, 17 attempted murders, 406 death threats, 179 assaults, and four kidnappings,[1][2] your pain must be very great seeing as your religion has been used to justify so many terrible acts.
Why don’t you do something about it? Your religion is being hijacked and we all hear nothing about it, just this silence and quiet denouncement.

Anyone can turn on their television and see Bill O’Reilly, Glenn Beck, Jerry Falwell, Pat Robertson and many other televangelists like the ones that converted the subject of this thread. You can watch them delivering touching rhetoric on abortion which clearly resonates with so many.

The pope as the leader of the Catholic church should be very concerned about his religion being hijacked to justify killing doctors. Does he say anything against it?
No, he talks about how abortion is a crime against society[3], likens it to Holocaust[4] and says it is corrupting society[5]. You’d think that in these statements he’s at least mention that killing abortion doctors is wrong.

If religious leaders didn’t want abortion doctors to be killed yet saw tens or hundreds of their followers attempting to do so, wouldn’t they say something about it? Wouldn’t they mention that their religion was being misused?
We hear nothing of that, we only hear about how terrible abortion is and that something must be done about it.

Do you understand why many in the pro-choice camp feel that you are liars?
Many feel you are all pretending to be upset, issuing statements about how much they deplore violence, but it’s just bullshit. Many people feel that this is exactly what you wanted to happen.

references:
(1) http://www.religioustolerance.org/abo_viol.htm
(2) http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2010/jan/24/warren-hern-america-late-abortion
(3) http://www.catholicnews.com/data/stories/cns/0506904.htm
(4) http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/4288103.stm
(5) http://www.euthanasia.com/pope2000.html

Read full topic

[/quote]

I don’t see how he isn’t a Christian like you when he worships the same Jesus, believes in the same God and derives his values from the same Bible.[/quote]

He certainly thinks he is religious. I’m saying that he isn’t doing what any Christian religion in the world would advocate, unless maybe he tries to start his own. Again, I’m against abortion because I think it is murder, but murdering people because they possibly may commit murder is not the solution, trying to convince them otherwise would be better.

But again, this isn’t a religious thing, it’s a crazy person thing. If another atheist is a serial killer, and he is arrested and locked up, and then we find out about another, would it be fair for me to post a thread entitled “Lock up one atheist maniac and another takes his place!”, implying that you, as an atheist, are crazy as well? I don’t think that would be fair. Same case here.

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

If I were Obama, I wouldn't want to debate me either because I know that I would lose and would be advocating evil, murder, and immorality. I know popularity means EVERYTHING to Obama, and Obama has no morals. Obama doesn't want to say anything that is unpopular. The simple and plain fact is this: He is nasty. A shower is insufficient to clean him. God needs to spiritually clean him internally with the blood of Jesus Christ which was shed at Calvary, fill Obama with the Holy Spirit, fill Obama with the Word Jesus Christ, fill Obama with the love of God and the love of Christ, fill Obama with humility to admit that he is wrong, and humble Obama. Obama is supremely unclean--the most unclean man I can think of. The very fact that he didn't even respond shows that he doesn't care much about his reputation. Otherwise, he would be repulsed and disgusted by the very thought of any abortion of any child at any age. He is afraid to debate me on this issue because he knows it will make him very unpopular. I am supremely superior to Obama. I'm like Lennox Lewis, and he's like Mike Tyson. Mike Tyson is braver than Obama, because at least Mike Tyson agreed to fight Lennox Lewis. Obama was too cowardly/scared/indifferent to even debate me. How more civil can a challenge get than a public debate? I was not asking Obama to box me. It would have been mind war. And my mind is superior to Obama's. I am the undisputed world champion of the abortion debate. Obama was too cowardly/scared/indifferent to even RESPOND!!! Abortion is wrong in every single case, and for Obama to disagree with me is indisputable proof that he is wrong. Obama is not even worthy to debate with me on the issue of abortion.

…
It is good to have humility and be humble.


love the hypocrisy

Read full topic
item.source: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

wow, I haven’t even seen that website.

But look at this

I graduated from law school at Southern Methodist University. I have a Juris Doctor, also known as a J.D., or JD. I went to the University of Texas at Dallas for college. I graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. My Grade Point Average ("GPA") in college which I graduated with was over a 3.8. Specifically, my GPA was a 3.848. 4.0 was the highest GPA possible. I am a piano teacher. I teach students of all ages, from elementary school to working professionals and adults to grandparents. You may contact me if you're interested. I can also teach violin lessons. I was in the Texas All-State Orchestra in High School. I was the concertmaster of L.V. Berkner High School in Richardson Texas. I was a member of the Greater Dallas Youth Orchestra ("GDYO").

What a waste of a mind. He is neither stupid nor crazy as some have said.

He’s like the professor of biochemistry Micheal Behe who believes in creationism, he’s not a stupid person but he uses his rational, intelligent mind to try to justify his dogmatic belief. It pains me to see his very capable mind being wasted away by this creationism.

I did something almost exactly like this when I believed in communism, using my rational intelligent (I hope) mind to justify communism and shit on capitalism.

Read full topic
item.source: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Of course its about religion, but you say in Jesus name. Theres nothing in that article that states that his religion was Christianity. Anyways some Christians are against abortion for reasons stated in the bible, some aren’t. Again, some Muslims are against abortion for reasons stated in the Qur’an, some aren’t. I love how everyone loves to blame it on Christians because it says religion.

You’re correct, the article doesn’t mention Christianity, however his website does:
http://erlyndon.com/default.aspx

Hi. My name is Joey Lo. I took the New York Bar Exam in February 2010. ... I am a religious person, and my first desire in life is to please a person I believe in--God. I love God, the Father in Heaven, Jesus Christ His only Son, and the Holy Spirit. I am a Christian. Currently, I am a fully-fledged and devout Roman Catholic Christian, in full communion with Pope Benedict the Sixteenth (XVI) whom I will always humbly submit to, the Holy See in Rome, Italy, the Holy Catholic Church of more than one billion official members. I have been a Christian since I was in the fourth grade in elementary school. I accepted Christ into my life when watching TV. Some guys were really strong and breaking ice. They invited me to accept Jesus into my life and ask him to forgive me for the ways I sinned. I did so, and I was changed. ... Abortion is WRONG in EVERY case, even when a woman is raped and she did not want to have a child, EVEN WHEN SHE WILL DIE IF SHE HAS THE CHILD, AND EVEN IF THE WOMAN WILL SURVIVE ONLY IF SHE KILLS THE BABY. That is the OBJECTIVE AND ABSOLUTE TRUTH. THAT IS THE ONLY CORRECT ANSWER.

Read full topic

[/quote]

I’m all for abortion but any proof to back that statement up?[/quote]

I think I can back this up although I hope Frell doesn’t mind me jumping the gun.

Einsteins are rare, we know this because in the 7 billion people in the world today, there are very very few Einsteins. We don’t know in advance if an embryo will grow up to be an Einstein.
You could follow a similar argument for Hitler.

item.title: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:335889”][quote author=c|p link=topic=432271.msg3173410#msg3173410 date=1270606821]
Let’s see how moparisthebest justifies this one.
[/quote]

Why would I? I’m against abortion because it is murder, so why would I justify murder in another case. Self defense is a different thing all together.

@yakman, this is far less religious and far more simply crazy person. You can’t blame this one on religion.[/quote]

But you can blame suicide bombings on religion?

Read full topic
item.source: Lock up one religious maniac and another takes his place!
